Plays > The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

– Click image to view.

The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

(女殺油地獄) (Onnakoroshi abura no jigoku)

Written By: Chikamatsu Monzaemon (近松門左衛門)

First Staged: 1721

Reference: Major Plays of Chikamatsu, translated by Donald Keene, (New York: Columbia University Press, 1961); Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 224, February 1984; Bunraku February 1982 Performance Program

Kashira:

Onna koyaku (女子役)

Fukeoyama (老女形)

Genta (源太)

Musume (娘)

Tsume (つめ)

Yokanbei (与勘平)

Hagataki (端敵)

Shūto (sewa) (舅（世話）)

Wakaotoko (若男)

Takeuji (武氏)

Baba (婆)

Kenbishi (検非違使)

Onoemon (斧右衛門)

Hayaku (端役)

Darasuke (陀羅助)

Koyaku (子役)

Otoko tsume (男つめ)

Hanaugoki (鼻動き)

Shūto (舅)

Sanmaime (三枚目)

Performances:

September 1973: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

July 1975: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

July 1978: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

February 1982: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

February 1984: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

March 1987: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

November 1989: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

August 1992: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

February 1997: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

August 1970: The Woman-Killer and the Hell of Oil

Scenes:

The Pilgrim's Song (順礼歌)

The Sake Shop (酒屋)

The Torture by Koto (阿古屋琴責)

The Travel Dance on Mount Yoshino (道行初音の旅)

Characters:

Okichi (女房お吉)

Okiyo (姉娘お清)

Tea stall proprietor (茶店の亭主)

Yohei (河内屋与兵衛)

Yagoro (刷毛の弥五郎)

Zembei (皆朱の善兵衛)

Kogiku (天王寺屋小菊)

Brothel Supervisor (天王寺屋花車)

Millionaire escort to Kogiku (会津の大尽蝋九)

Moriemon (山本森右衛門)

Hachiya (小栗八弥)

Shichizaemon (豊島屋七左衛門)

Pilgrimage leader (山上講先達)

Tokubei (河内屋徳兵衛)

Osawa (徳兵衛女房お沢)

Tahei (河内屋太兵衛)

Priest (稲荷法印)

Okachi (妹おかち)

Kohei (綿屋小兵衛)

Gorokuro (帳紙屋五郎九郎)

Okichi's second daughter (中娘)

Head of police unit (捕手頭)

Maid (下女)

Buddhist devotees (講中)

Members of religionist group (同行衆)

Policemen (捕手)
